description: A new artificial intelligence model measures how fast a patient's brain is aging and could be a powerful new tool for understanding, preventing and treating cognitive decline and dementia.
title: New AI model measures how fast the brain ages

description: Bigger animals consistently show higher prevalence of both benign and malignant tumors.
title: Bigger animals get more cancer, defying decades-old belief

description: There's an arms race in medicine -- scientists design drugs to treat lethal bacterial infections, but bacteria can evolve defenses to those drugs, sending the researchers back to square one. A team describes the development of a drug candidate that can stop bacteria before they have a chance to cause harm.
title: Scientists invent new drug candidates to treat antibiotic-resistant bacteria

description: Remember when 2 degrees Celsius of global warming was the doomsday scenario? Well, we're now staring down the barrel of something much worse. From the fish on your plate to the weather outside your window, everything's about to change. A new study underscores the grave risks posed by insufficient national commitments to reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
title: Arctic study urges stronger climate action to prevent catastrophic warming

description: New research uncovers the survival strategy juvenile Chinook salmon adopt to migrate to the ocean, providing insight on how to conserve the threatened fish.
title: How young salmon navigate a gauntlet of danger en route to the sea

description: Knowing where, when and for how long mallard ducks -- natural carriers of avian influenza -- stop and rest as they migrate can help predict the probability that they will spread bird flu to backyard poultry flocks, according to a new study.
title: Backyard poultry face bird flu risk when migrating mallards stop to rest

description: Using a four-dimensional microscopy technique, researchers have created 3D video images of mouse lung tissue grown in the laboratory. What they have learned has been nothing short of groundbreaking.
title: Bottling a mouse 'superpower' may heal lungs damaged by premature birth

description: Aortic valve stenosis (AVS) is a significant health concern affecting over 1.5 million Americans and millions more globally. Researchers are exploring the use of a new drug called ataciguat to manage AVS. Results from preclinical and clinical studies show that ataciguat has the potential to significantly slow disease progression.
title: New drug may reduce need for aortic valve surgeries by slowing disease progression

description: Working memory is what allows humans to juggle different pieces of information in short-term scenarios, like making a mental grocery list and then going shopping or remembering and then dialing a phone number. While scientists agree that the capacity of working memory is limited, they offer competing theories about how and why this is true. But new research shows why limits on working memory exist.
title: How humans learn to optimize working memory

description: Researchers have found that people with diabetes can achieve the same positive results using advanced insulin technology when trained by their primary care providers (PCPs) or through telehealth as they would by seeing a specialist in person.
title: Study shows primary care and telehealth can deliver life-changing diabetes care

description: Researchers say they found that infection with a common virus that can be transmitted from mother to fetus before birth significantly worsens an often-fatal complication of premature birth called necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC) in experiments with mice.
title: Research suggests common viral infection worsens deadly condition among premature babies

description: From the perspective of complex systems, the study reveals the universality, specificity, and explanatory power of underlying rules governing urban system evolution.
title: Underlying rules of evolutionary urban systems in Africa

description: A new service aimed at supporting older people who are starting to become frail, could reduce emergency hospital admissions by more than a third.
title: New home-based intervention could reduce emergency hospital admissions for older people

description: Diabetes and obesity have become pressing health issues worldwide. Glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonists, a class of medications widely used in the treatment of type 2 diabetes (T2D), have shown significant effectiveness in both lowering blood sugar levels and aiding weight loss due to their unique pharmacological mechanisms. A research team assessed the impact of GLP-1 receptor agonist in weight loss through genetic studies, aiming to understand whether the use of these medications reduces weight due to muscle or fat mass loss. This genetic study revealed that GLP-1 receptor agonists reduce weight by reducing more fat mass than muscle mass.
title: Genetic evidence that diabetes drug GLP-1 receptor agonists achieve weight loss primarily by reducing fat mass more than muscle

description: The gut bacteria of giraffes are not primarily determined by what they eat, but by the species they belong to. This is shown in a new study in which researchers have analyzed the link between diet and gut flora in three giraffe species in Kenya. The study also provides new knowledge that can help secure the food supply of endangered giraffe species.
title: Unexpected discoveries in study of giraffe gut flora

description: It is no strange sight to see icebergs break off of the Antarctic ice cap and drift away, like the gigantic sheet of ice that is currently heading for the island of South Georgia. But climate change is making it happen more frequently, with ever-larger icebergs in the waters around Antarctica. Researchers are studying the routes that icebergs followed during geological periods of rapid ice cap deterioration, such as the ends of ice ages. That provides crucial information about the effect of melting icebergs on the oceans, and its consequences for the future. In the process, they also found an explanation for the mysterious discovery of ancient material from Antarctica near South Orkney, an island to the southwest of South Georgia.
title: Mega-iceberg from Antarctica on collision course with South Georgia: Harbinger of things to come?

description: Scientists have developed an AI-powered tool that detects 64% of brain abnormalities linked to epilepsy that human radiologists miss.
title: AI to diagnose 'invisible' brain abnormalities in children with epilepsy

description: A research team has found that telemedicine may help to reduce the use of low-value tests.
title: Telemedicine may help reduce use of unnecessary health tests

description: New analysis of ancient fossilized rocks known as stromatolites, preserved in southern Zimbabwe, suggests strong links to hydrothermal nutrient recycling, 'meaning that early life may in part have been fueled by volcanic activity'.
title: Research provides new detail on the impact of volcanic activity on early marine life
